plugins.name: Populate
plugins.description:
Effortlessly link your text and image layers with 130+ properties across 20+ unique categories. Then with one click, populate your designs with authentic, detailed data. Upgrade to Pro to create custom categories using your own data.


Check out a demo video to see the plugin in action, or learn how to use it yourself by jumping into the playground file. Click Try it out or duplicate the file here.


ü§î What can Populate do?

  1. Building a movie recommendation app? Link your movie title layer with the title property, link your movie poster with the poster property, and repeat for the director, genre, runtime, release year, etc. Now you‚Äôre one click away from filling all your design screens with real movie data across your entire design file.
  2. Need to use company information in your design? Why not populate your design with real companies, along with real logos, stock tickers, market caps, CEOs, and headquarters?
  3. What about a weather app? Generate a random city and fetch realtime weather data like conditions, wind speed, temperature, and even a weather icon.
  4. NEW: How about using your own data? Import data from Google Sheets to create custom categories.
  5. Check out the Categories and Properties list below to get the full picture.


‚úÖ Categories and Properties

  1. Albums: Title, Artist, Genre, Year, Cover
  2. Beers: Name, Brand, Style, IBU, Alcohol By Volume
  3. Books: Title, Author, Year, Language, Genre
  4. Cities & Weather: City, State, City & State, Population, Current Temperature, Current Wind Speed, Current Conditions, Current Conditions Icon
  5. Colors: Name, Hex Code, Red Value, Green Value, Blue Value, Swatch
  6. Companies: Name, Ticker, Market Cap, CEO, Headquarters, Logo
  7. Countries: Name, Country Code, Region, Subregion, Population, Languages, Currency, Currency Code, Flag
  8. Credit Cards: Card Number, Expiration Date, CVV, Card Holder, Card Network
  9. Cryptocurrencies: Name, Symbol, Price (USD), Market Cap (USD), Percent Change (Day and Week)
  10. Disney Characters: Name, Source, Image
  11. Dogs: Name, Breed, Image
  12. Flights & Airports: Airline, Data, Departure (Airport, Code, City, Time), Arrival (Airport, Code, City, Time)
  13. Jobs: Title, Industry, Average Salary, Education Required
  14. Movies: Title, Director, Genre, Year, Runtime, Rating, Poster
  15. Playing Cards: Card, Value, Suit, Suit Symbol, Image
  16. Pok√©mon: Name, ID, Weight, Sprite
  17. Quotes: Text, Author
  18. Recipes: Name, Type, Preparation Time, Servings, Calories, Country of Origin, Image
  19. Trivia Questions: Question, 4 Unique Answers
  20. Users: First Name, Last Name, Full Name, Gender, Company, Username, Password, Email, Birthday, Age, City & State, Address, Phone, User ID, Avatar
  21. Words: Word, Definition, Sentence, Part of Speech, Phonetic
  22. Date & Time: Date, Time, Time (24hr), Combined Date & Time, Day of Week, 5 Alternate Date Displays

plugins.name: Codia AI PDF: Import PDF/PowerPoint/Keynote to Figma
plugins.description:
Harness the power of advanced AI technology with AI PDF: Figma PDF Master, Online PDF Editor. This innovative Figma plugin transforms your static PDF files into stunning, fully editable Figma designs with unprecedented ease and precision.


Key Features:

- Convert PDF to Figma Designs: Seamlessly convert your PDF documents into beautifully crafted Figma designs. Our cutting-edge AI ensures that the original layout and design elements are meticulously preserved.

- Fully Editable Figma Layers: Experience unmatched flexibility with fully editable layers. Our AI technology breaks down your PDF into individual components, allowing you to modify text, images, and other design elements effortlessly.

- Robust Privacy Protection: We prioritize your privacy. Utilizing state-of-the-art security measures, we ensure that your sensitive information remains protected throughout the conversion process.


Why Choose AI PDF: Figma PDF Master?

- Advanced AI Integration: Leveraging the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, our plugin offers unparalleled accuracy and efficiency in converting PDFs to Figma designs.

- User-Friendly Interface: Designed with designers in mind, our intuitive interface makes the conversion process straightforward and quick, saving you valuable time and effort.

- Enhanced Design Workflow: Transform your design workflow by seamlessly integrating your PDFs into Figma, enabling a more cohesive and efficient design process.


How do I import PowerPoint or Keynote into Figma?

You can first export the file as a PDF from PowerPoint or Keynote, then import the PDF into Figma using Codia AI PDF.


Transform your design workflow and elevate your PDFs to new heights with AI PDF: Figma PDF Master. Try it now and experience the ultimate in design conversion technology!

plugins.name: Hand‚Ä∫‚Ä∫over
plugins.description:
Selection-based pixel to rem conversion, with modifiable base pixel and scale.


Need to handover to developers? Tired of trying to figure out what the relative em value would be for your pixels? Well, no longer.


With Hand‚Ä∫‚Ä∫over you can:


  • Open the plugin without selections to convert any number to rem
  • Select an element anywhere in your files and open the plugin to see the current pixel value and convert it to rem
  • Change the current selection to update the input value and enable a new conversion
  • Change the baseline px value to whatever you want it to be and see the relevant changes in em conversion
  • Change the scale by which you want to convert based on common scales used
  • Copy or export the conversions as CSS


These plugins are free to use, but if you fancy buying me a coffee because it's been useful to you, I'd be grateful: https://ko-fi.com/kemiljk

accepted.description: Currently building DuckDuckGo, Cosmic, Hand‚Ä∫‚Ä∫over, and plugins.run.

plugins.name: Blob Generator
plugins.description:
Overview

Blob Generator is a plugin on Figma that allows users to easily create Blob shapes.

Through the Parameter, you can adjust settings like "Growth" and "Edges", helping you craft the exact Blob shape you're seeking.


Random Blob & Fixed Blob

Additionally, Blob Generator always produces two types of blobs simultaneously Random Blob and Fixed Blob.

You can choose and use whichever you prefer at any time.

  1. Random Blob : Creates a new Blob without inheriting the previous Blob's state.
  2. Fixed Blob : Generates a new Blob while retaining the state of the previous Blob.


How to Use

  1. Launch the plugin.
  2. Adjust the "Growth" and "Edges" to get your desired Blob shape. Alternatively, you can use the automatically generated Dynamic Preset when you start the plugin. If you find a Blob in the preset group at the bottom of the screen that matches your preference, you can simply click on it.
  3. Once you've adjusted the Parameter and achieved the Blob shape you're looking for, press the "Insert Blob" button. The Blob will be added to the selected location (or the center of the canvas if nothing is selected).


How to Adjust Parameters

Growth

The "Growth" parameter allows you to control the variation of the Blob.

A smaller value results in more drastic changes, whereas a larger value reduces the changes, making the shape closer to a perfect circle.

Edges

"Edges" lets you adjust the number of corners (points) the Blob has.

A smaller value will give the Blob smoother curves, while a larger value will make the Blob more jagged.


How to Use the Buttons

  1. In the upper right corner of the Fixed Blob, there's a "üîÑRefresh" button, which allows you to change the Seed value. By changing the Seed value, you can modify the overall design direction of the Fixed Blob.

64813.name: Blob Generator
64813.description:
Overview

Blob Generator is a plugin on Figma that allows users to easily create Blob shapes.

Through the Parameter, you can adjust settings like "Growth" and "Edges", helping you craft the exact Blob shape you're seeking.


Random Blob & Fixed Blob

Additionally, Blob Generator always produces two types of blobs simultaneously Random Blob and Fixed Blob.

You can choose and use whichever you prefer at any time.

  1. Random Blob : Creates a new Blob without inheriting the previous Blob's state.
  2. Fixed Blob : Generates a new Blob while retaining the state of the previous Blob.


How to Use

  1. Launch the plugin.
  2. Adjust the "Growth" and "Edges" to get your desired Blob shape. Alternatively, you can use the automatically generated Dynamic Preset when you start the plugin. If you find a Blob in the preset group at the bottom of the screen that matches your preference, you can simply click on it.
  3. Once you've adjusted the Parameter and achieved the Blob shape you're looking for, press the "Insert Blob" button. The Blob will be added to the selected location (or the center of the canvas if nothing is selected).


How to Adjust Parameters

Growth

The "Growth" parameter allows you to control the variation of the Blob.

A smaller value results in more drastic changes, whereas a larger value reduces the changes, making the shape closer to a perfect circle.

Edges

"Edges" lets you adjust the number of corners (points) the Blob has.

A smaller value will give the Blob smoother curves, while a larger value will make the Blob more jagged.


How to Use the Buttons

  1. In the upper right corner of the Fixed Blob, there's a "üîÑRefresh" button, which allows you to change the Seed value. By changing the Seed value, you can modify the overall design direction of the Fixed Blob.
  2. In the upper right corner of the Parameter, there's a "üîÄRandom" button that can randomly generate Growth and Edges parameters.
  3. The "üîÑRefresh Presets" button in the upper right corner of the Dynamic Preset allows you to regenerate the entire Dynamic Preset.

plugins.name: Color Import / Export
plugins.description:
This plugin aims to help design and development teams stay in sync by providing import and export tools for Figma color palettes.


üì∫ Watch The Video Tutorial


Features


Import


  • Import color styles into Figma from JSON objects
  • Group color styles and color cards by folders
  • Preview imported colors in real time


Export


  • Export selected color styles to JSON, JavaScript, CSS, or Sass
  • Choose between HEX, RGB, or HSL output color models
  • Choose output casing style such as camel case, snake case, and more
  • Preview color export by simply selecting objects on the canvas



Bugs Reports & Feature Requests


Found a bug or have a feature you'd like to see? Please open an issue on the GitHub page at https://github.com/jsakas/figma-plugin-color-import-export.

plugins.name: Merge it
plugins.description:
Merge it is a plugin that can let you merge those similar, duplicated, inconsistent style components in your design system.


How to use:

1. Select at least two components

2. Run plugin

3. Choose the component you want to keep (You will be relocated at each component position when selecting. It helps to find the one you want to keep.)

4. Click Merge

5. The other symbols will be removed, and all of their instances will be replaced by the one you chose to keep, keeping overrides whenever it is possible

6. Enjoy!


Please feel free to suggest features or give advices to https://github.com/ericyip/figma-plugins

14391.name: Merge it
14391.description:
Merge it is a plugin that can let you merge those similar, duplicated, inconsistent style components in your design system.


How to use:

1. Select at least two components

2. Run plugin

3. Choose the component you want to keep (You will be relocated at each component position when selecting. It helps to find the one you want to keep.)

4. Click Merge

5. The other symbols will be removed, and all of their instances will be replaced by the one you chose to keep, keeping overrides whenever it is possible

6. Enjoy!

plugins.name: Buzzy - No Code Native App & Website Builder
plugins.description:
Check this 1 min video - you‚Äôd love it.


Create fully working native apps and responsive websites, MVPs or prototypes with real data, user-generated content and live forms straight from Figma, without coding.


This is a full stack solution, not just the front end code - it includes the database, business logic, storage (s3), the lots; then publish to your own domain or the app store (Apple and/or Android).


Iterate Faster

WIth Buzzy, you get a live app you can edit and update directly from Figma. Color changes? No problem. New section? Done. User tests with real data and working forms? Easy!


How it works

  1. Install the Buzzy plugin and connect your file
  2. Mark up your design
  3. Publish


Want to get started now?

  1. Go to our Getting Started guide and watch easy to follow step-by-step video tutorials
  2. Grab an example file and see how it‚Äôs done
  3. Install Buzzy and mark up your file


Questions? Jump on Discord or email us - we‚Äôre happy to help!


Resources

  1. Getting Started tutorials
  2. Support page
  3. Discord channel
  4. email us at support@buzzycompany.com

plugins.description:
Effortlessly link your project management tool (Jira, ClickUp, Monday) and Figma with Ticket Sync.


Boost your design workflow with:


Ticket integration: Import tickets directly in Figma.

Effortless linking: Create one-click connections between tickets and relevant Figma designs, ensuring clear traceability.

Synchronized progress: Make changes in your project management tool and see them reflected in Figma, keeping everyone in sync.

Customizable tickets: Tailor the design and content of your tickets in Figma for improved information clarity.

One-click sync: (PRO) Effortlessly synchronize all tickets with a single click, saving valuable time.

Custom field display: (PRO) Showcase crucial information by displaying specific custom fields from your project management tool directly in Figma.


Streamline collaboration and communication with Ticket Sync!

networkAccess.reasoning: 1. Ticket Sync uses a proxy server to fetch data. Figma plugins can't directly access APIs, as they are opened in an iFrame that can't send an origin. Therefore, the CORS policy prevents direct access. The proxy server forwards the data via a secure HTTPS connection and does not save any data. 2. The website rsms.me is used to load the font Inter.

plugins.name: Pencil Pal
plugins.description:
Pencil Pal is for folks who want to get a little more out of the pencil tool.


This tiny yet mighty utility enables users to select fill, stroke and opacity before and during drawing. While Figma has similar functionality for managing the pencil tool, here are four reasons why you'd use the plugin:


  1. It takes up less space than the standard panel
  2. You can use the plugin even if you hide the UI
  3. It has color switching features that work in a compact view
  4. It now has Scribble mode!


Select from 28 colors, 10 of which you can customize and save! Tap the "Pal" label to toggle colors.


To import a custom swatch, select any pencil line and tap any empty swatch space to import its style. Double tap a custom swatch space to clear it.


Edit your last-drawn pencil line in real time by changing stroke, width and color instantly!


Pencil Pal's compact design maximizes your drawing canvas.


Use the brand new Scribble mode to create new text nodes or add instances.

accepted.name: Nelson Taruc
accepted.description: My design philosophy: Focus. Boost signal, kill noise. Solve the first problem. Embrace uncertainty.

18537.name: Pencil Pal
18537.description:
Pencil Pal is for folks who want to get a little more out of the pencil tool.


This tiny yet mighty utility enables users to select fill, stroke and opacity before and during drawing. While Figma has similar functionality for managing the pencil tool, here are four reasons why you'd use the plugin:


  1. It takes up less space than the standard panel
  2. You can use the plugin even if you hide the UI
  3. It has color switching features that work in a compact view
  4. It now has Scribble mode!


Select from 28 colors, 10 of which you can customize and save! Tap the "Pal" label to toggle colors.


To import a custom swatch, select any pencil line and tap any empty swatch space to import its style. Double tap a custom swatch space to clear it.


Edit your last-drawn pencil line in real time by changing stroke, width and color instantly!


Pencil Pal's compact design maximizes your drawing canvas.


Use the brand new Scribble mode to create new text nodes or add instances.


We can't wait to see what you draw next with Pencil Pal!
18537.release_notes: Fixed scrollbar bug and added experimental Scribble mode.

plugins.name: Frame Tags
plugins.description:
Frame tags makes it easy to add tags to the top of frames and components to help show the stage the designs are at. This makes it easy to communicate with collaborators where attention may be required.

You can currently choose from the following list of tags:

  • Draft
  • Approved
  • Complete
  • Work in progress
  • Content required
  • Research required
  • Approval required
  • Revised
  • On hold
  • Ready for review
  • Ready for dev


How to use:

  1. Select the frames and/or components you want to add tags to
  2. Run the Frame Tags plugin
  3. If using a preset tag, you‚Äôre all done!
  4. If using the Frame Tags UI, select the tag, size and color
  5. Click 'Create tag'


Roadmap:

  1. When adding new tag to existing frame, replace old one rather than adding another on top
  2. Ability to add your own tags
  3. Ability to save custom colors to the swatch


If you have any tags you would like added to the plugin or have any other feature requests or support questions, feel free to email me.

Email: michael@mtmeyer.net
plugins.tagline: See at a glance what stage designs are at.

Magezon Figma to Code (HTML, CSS) allows you to convert your Figma designs into production-ready HTML and CSS with one click. This will significantly speed up your design-to-development process.

plugins.name: FrameBrowser
plugins.description:
Your friendly portable mini web browser.

FrameBrowser lets you have a browser window open inside of Figma. Handy if you need to embed content, do live previewing, or checking in with third-party services like Miro, Mural or InVision.

Content not loading? Please note that many sites don't allow embedding their content in iframes. This is something set in their server headers and is nothing you or I can do anything about. You will simply get a blank screen if that happens.

Using FrameBrowser
- In Figma, under Plugins, click FrameBrowser
- Give FrameBrowser a URL (it will replace HTTP with HTTPS, and will add HTTPS if it's missing from URL)
- If you'd like, you can specify the dimensions of the window (minimum 200px and maximum 2560px)
- Note: FrameBrowser will respect your height value but always adds a tiny bit for the settings selector button on top
- Click Run, and it should load!
- Use the settings button to change URL if needed

accepted.name: Mikael Vesavuori
accepted.description: Technical Standards Lead at Polestar

plugins.name: story.to.design ‚Äî by ‚Äπdiv‚Ä∫RIOTS ‚Äî Import Storybook components to Figma components
plugins.description:
Generate and sync a full Figma library from Storybook or Histoire.


story.to.design imports your components from Storybook to Figma. You‚Äôll get notified any time the code changes in Storybook to update your Figma components in a single click. Less grunt work, more design time.


[Go to Homepage]


How it works:

  1. Install this plugin, story.to.design
  2. On a blank Figma file, search for ‚Äústory.to.design‚Äù under Plugins, or using cmd+/
  3. In your browser, open your Storybook and copy the URL
  4. Paste the URL into the plugin, select the components and variants you want and click ‚ÄòImport‚Äô
  5. story.to.design automatically converts your coded components into native Figma components


Why use story.to.design?

  1. Want a better handoff with developers? story.to.design
  2. Better design quality? Design with components that look exactly like production.
  3. Faster go-to-market? Imagine having your full UI library all ready in under 2 hours!


Key features:

  1. Syncs components when Storybook stories change
  2. Works with any story framework
  3. Imports sub-components
  4. Simulates states
  5. Supports component properties and variants
  6. Private Storybooks now supported too!


------------------------------

Brought to you by ‚Äπdiv‚Ä∫RIOTS

üí¨ Chat with us

------------------------------

plugins.name: Weblify Code Inspector (Beta)
plugins.description:
Documentation


For Weblify documentation, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/weblify


Questions & Support


Weblify is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions about the plugin, please get in touch directly via https://hypermatic.com/contact and we'll help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


Security


Weblify is designed to be privacy and security focused ‚Äî for details about security and how the plugin works, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/weblify/security


Features


  1. Inspect a Figma layer's markup and styles with one click.
  2. Toggle between HTML/CSS, Tailwind, React or Vue code output.
  3. Integrates with Figma's native "Dev Mode" inspector panel.
  4. Supports auto-layout, wrapping and min/max Figma properties.
  5. View a live HTML preview of your HTML in the plugin.
  6. Instantly copy code directly to your clipboard.
  7. Download your code component as a .zip file.
  8. Includes assets folder if your layers contain images.
  9. No external APIs or logins required.


Click on a Figma layer to view it as HTML, Tailwind, React or Vue code.

Inspect your Figma layers in the same code framework as your development environment.


Visually preview your code in real-time.

Instantly see how your code will render in the browser at different screen sizes with one click, directly inside the Figma plugin.


Native integration with the Figma ‚ÄúDev Mode‚Äù panel.

Allow your developers to use Weblify without needing to have ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù access to your Figma design with the native Figma ‚ÄúDev Mode‚Äù panel integration.


Privacy and security focused ‚Äî nothing ever leaves your Figma file.

Weblify doesn‚Äôt upload, store or process any Figma data outside of the plugin, everything happens securely inside your Figma file, and any exported files are downloaded directly to your computer.


Weblify Pro


10 free trials of Weblify Pro are included with the free version, and if you're a casual user, you can continue using the free version of Weblify forever.


If you're a power user, you can optionally upgrade to continue using all the extra features that are only available in the pro version of Weblify.


To learn more about Weblify Pro, please visit https://www.hypermatic.com/weblify/#pro

  7. Download your code component as a .zip file.
  8. Includes assets folder if your layers contain images.
  9. No external APIs or logins required.


Click on a Figma layer to view it as HTML, Tailwind, React or Vue code.

Inspect your Figma layers in the same code framework as your development environment.


Visually preview your code in real-time.

Instantly see how your code will render in the browser at different screen sizes with one click, directly inside the Figma plugin.


Native integration with the Figma ‚ÄúDev Mode‚Äù panel.

Allow your developers to use Weblify without needing to have ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù access to your Figma design with the native Figma ‚ÄúDev Mode‚Äù panel integration.


Privacy and security focused ‚Äî nothing ever leaves your Figma file.

Weblify doesn‚Äôt upload, store or process any Figma data outside of the plugin, everything happens securely inside your Figma file, and any exported files are downloaded directly to your computer.


Weblify Pro


10 free trials of Weblify Pro are included with the free version, and if you're a casual user, you can continue using the free version of Weblify forever.


If you're a power user, you can optionally upgrade to continue using all the extra features that are only available in the pro version of Weblify.


To learn more about Weblify Pro, please visit https://www.hypermatic.com/weblify/#pro

networkAccess.reasoning: Weblify queries hypermatic.com to validate licenses for Pro users and load assets to speed up plugin loading times. Weblify also queries googleapis.com to render any Google Fonts used in the HTML preview feature.

plugins.name: prompt2design
plugins.description:
Generate any design based on your prompt with figma.


This plugin is currently in beta, you can request access on www.prompt2design.io


Select the type of device what do you want, write the prompt and generate your interface!


üëâ Next update coming soon:

  • Optimize dropdown in navbar
  • AI Generation in real time


Prompt example:

generate card with login form


The card's padding must be have 30px

First input of the form is "Your email address"

Second input of the form is "Your password"

The form must be have 2 radio buttons : admin and user

The primary is "Login!"


Components available:

  • Card
  • Form (input, radio button, checkbox, textarea...)
  • Buttons
  • Accordion
  • List items
  • Navbar


Specify your styles

You can specify the styles.

Currently, you can specify these styles :

  • Color background
  • Padding
  • Spacing between elements
  • Border radius
  • width
  • height


Material UI Components

You can use material components and access to properties.

Currently, you have access to :

  • buttons (primary, secondary)
  • input
  • select
  • radio
  • textarea
  • checkbox

plugins.name: Confetti Generator
plugins.description:
Overview

"Confetti Generator" is a Figma plugin that allows you to effortlessly introduce vibrant confetti designs into your projects. With precise parameter adjustments and intuitive mouse-drag operations, you can enhance presentations and event-related designs with a touch of charm.


Key Features

  1. Customizable Confetti: Modify shapes (squares, triangles, stars, etc.), size, and colors with great detail. Preset color options are also available.
  2. Detailed Parameter Adjustments: Fine-tune the number, uniformity, and overall form of the confetti.
  3. Add with Mouse Drag: Easily introduce confetti into the design via mouse drag operations.
  4. Random Placement: Instantly auto-place hundreds of confetti particles, pursuing real-time representation.


How to Use

  1. Launch the plugin and select the detailed settings for the confetti.
  2. Adjust the amount, placement, and colors of the confetti as needed.
  3. Click the "Insert Confetti" button to embed it into Figma.
